meanings.definition: To put or keep in jail.
meanings.sent1: The police were jailing the criminal for stealing.
meanings.sent2: She was jailing the dangerous prisoner to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The judge joked about jailing the mischievous cat for stealing treats.
meanings.sent4: His guilt was jailing him more than any prison ever could.
meanings.sent5: The thought of jailing the culprit brought a sense of justice to the victim.

meanings.definition: The act of putting or keeping in jail.
meanings.sent1: The jailing of the suspect was necessary for public safety.
meanings.sent2: She witnessed the jailing of the criminal firsthand.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a skit about the chaos of jailing mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The jailing of the corrupt official sent shockwaves through the town.
meanings.sent5: The news report detailed the jailing of the notorious gang leader.
